intro: Schizoglossum delagoense, commonly known as the African orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pale green to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Schizoglossum delagoense is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as savannas and rocky outcrops.
